hypothesis_content.title: BTC Volatility Compression Breakout with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades within a 5-day Bollinger Band width percentile below 20% (compression) during a NEUTRAL regime, a daily close above the 20-day upper Bollinger Band with volume exceeding its 20-day average by 50% signals a high-probability directional breakout that persists for at least 3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression during neutral periods represents indecision; a high-volume breakout from this compression often initiates a new short-term trend as trapped positions are forced to react. The NEUTRAL regime filter avoids false breakouts during high-volatility stress periods.
entry_conditions: BTC daily close > Upper Bollinger Band (20,2)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3-day holding period close OR 8% gain from entry, whichever comes first
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Daily close back inside Bollinger Bands
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 days if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Majority of signals (≥60%) fail to produce a 3-day continuation move exceeding 2% in breakout direction, or immediate reversal back inside bands occurs within 48 hours.
